comments.creator: steve@therothmans.org
comments.raw_text:
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; en-US; rv:1.8.0.1) Gecko/20060111 Firefox/1.5.0.1 Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; en-US; rv:1.8.0.1) Gecko/20060111 Firefox/1.5.0.1 This may be a duplicate of bug 310643, except that the example given in that bug works now, and this doesn't. The page is displayed correctly in IE6 (you guys are probably tired of hearing that!) The URL is unfortuantely from logging out of a private area, so it won't work directly. Below is the page source. If I save the page, it only offers to save it as text, not "Web Page, complete", so it seems pretty clear that it doesn't recognize it as HTML. If I save the text to a *.htm or *.html file, it displays that local copy correctly. If you need more info or testing, I'll be glad to supply it. ORBCOMM Web Services

Actual Results: "Successfully Logged Out" page displayed as text of HTML source. Expected Results: Display formatted HTML. comments.creator: sendmail.to@gmx.de
comments.raw_text:
The MIME type is text/plain and IE ignores the MIME type.
I think this is no Bug.
comments.text:
The MIME type is text/plain and IE ignores the MIME type.
I think this is no Bug.
comments.author: sendmail.to@gmx.de

comments.raw_text:
The website is using MIME-type text/plain, not text/html. That's incorrect. Gecko respects the MIM-type in the Content-Type header (standards-compliant), Explorer looks at the content (non-standards compliant). 

http://validator.w3.org/check?uri=http%3A%2F%2Forbservices.orbcomm.net%2FSPI%2FSPILogout%3FsessionID%3D1143472030631%26refNum%3D118
comments.creator: jo.hermans@gmail.com
